snippet.title: Kangaroo attacks man, mauls woman who tried to help
snippet.content: A woman has been treated in hospital after she was attacked by a kangaroo on a Gold Coast golf course. Paramedics said the woman, believed to be in her 50s, had gone to the aid of a man who was being attacked on the driving range.Photo: Mark Graham Crews were called to the driving range at the prestigious Links Hope Island golf course about 8.10am on Tuesday. Queensland Ambulance Service acting senior operations supervisor Bill Houghton said the woman suffered a deep cut to the back of her head and minor cuts and bruises to her back and hands. "The crew reported on the scene that the kangaroo initially approached a male who was on a driving range," he said. "He tried to attack the male. "The female went across to assist the gentleman that was being attacked and the kangaroo retaliated and attacked the female patient." She was taken to the Gold Coast Private Hospital in a stable condition and released later in the day. The man escaped injury.
